main event: Two witnesses reported seeing strange lights and objects in the sky over Cheshire, Ohio on March 9, 1959, and a subsequent sighting reported on March 16, 1959.
interesting points: The first witness described observing a light moving at high speed larger than the stars, it projected several beams of light downward., The second witness experienced static on his car radio while observing the object, which was about 300' up and noticed lights dimming., One of the witnesses said he was ordered by a voice to keep back when he observed the object closely., The first sighting lasted for about 5 minutes and involved a single object., No photographs are present in the records, only text summaries of the events.
sighted object: luminous, oblong object and unusual lights
witness description: Two individuals, one who was walking and another who was driving.
